title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When I open an editor on the file, make changes to it, and then select 'Revert' from the popup menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original. However, if I close the editor and reopen it, it only takes about 8 seconds.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Make changes to the file by adding a space character at the end of the first line.
3) Close the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab and select 'No' when prompted to save changes.
4) Reopen the file by double clicking on it in the navigator.
5) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
6) Instead of closing and reopening the editor, select 'Revert' from the popup menu in the editor.
7) Observe that it takes 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original.
